intro: Stenogyne integra, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark is thick and rugged, providing structural support and protection against environmental stressors. Stenogyne integra plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian forests, supporting a variety of native insects and birds.
